lines.content: As I walked down the cool, gray sidewalk below;
Surrounded by dancing, black pine trees;
As the purple and blue void envelopes;
With lights pierced through, which look like beads;
And as I looked at the stoic buildings with glowing windows,
And see the moving pictures on people’s televisions,
Or young women readying themselves for sleep,
I thought to myself,
What a beautiful evening to kill myself
(And to use the same word to end-rhyme with itself).
The smell of petrol, automobile’s per-fumes;
Listening as these machines hum and zoom;
What perfect, beautiful creatures they would be
To collide into and demolish me.
The still ponds, dark as America’s past;
Hearing the sound of crickets, shrouded in the grass;
And feeling the cool waves of the waters, I begin
To think of what a perfect place this is to drown myself in.
Old buildings, rusted with the detailed dirt of time;
Glow with mesmerizing, yellow bright lights;
Pushing up against the sky, these giants stand so high;
That I might be able to jump myself to an early demise.
Gleaming at the flurry of colors and sounds,
I realize that I am in peace right now.
Maybe this blurriness is caused by these
Surroundings to which I am invested;
Or maybe it is that cyanide pill I just ingested.
